txt.en:
'We have neither the time, nor the means to restore all of Walstow, but I believe you can aid us with some small repairs.

'Along the stream to the west, there are a great number of reeds. These reeds can be used to repair the rooves for the townsfolk here in Walstow.

'However, these reeds are very close to the Orc-camps nearby. It is more than likely that you may quickly find yourself surrounded by Orcs while there. That said, be swift about your business. I will await your return.'
'Wonderful work, [placeholder]. I hope the Orcs did not cause you too much trouble. \n\n'I will alert my men and have them begin repairs while you and I continue to work on reinforcing Walstow.'
The town of Walstow is falling into ruin, and the townsfolk need aid with repairs.

Reeds can be found along the stream to the south-west of Walstow.\n\nWinsig wants you to aid the crofters of Walstow in repairing their rapidly deteriorating town. The reeds along the nearby stream should be suitable for repairing rooves.
Winsig can be found inside the Mead Hall of Walstow.\n\nYou should return to Winsig with news of your success.
